summary: H. Clark Schor is identified as the author of several memoranda in January 1978, addressed to SA/DO/O. These memos respond to a request from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) for information on various individuals and entities. Schor's role appears to be providing details on the types and quantities of documents held by the Central Cover Staff (CCS) related to the HSCA's inquiries. The memos detail the contents and dates of relevant files held by the CCS.
significance: H. Clark Schor's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his role as a point of contact for the HSCA's information requests, specifically related to documents held by the Central Cover Staff (CCS). He facilitated the provision of information on individuals and organizations of interest to the HSCA investigation.
